messages.content:
You are an assistant that is an expert in generating sqlite SQL queries.
Having the access to database content, generate a correct sqlite SQL query for the given question.
### Database content ###
        
CREATE TABLE management (
	"department_ID" INTEGER, 
	"head_ID" INTEGER, 
	temporary_acting TEXT, 
	PRIMARY KEY ("department_ID", "head_ID"), 
	FOREIGN KEY("head_ID") REFERENCES head ("head_ID"), 
	FOREIGN KEY("department_ID") REFERENCES department ("Department_ID")
)
/*
Columns in management and all categories for low cardinality columns :
department_ID : 7, 15, 2, 11
head_ID : 5, 4, 6, 3, 10
temporary_acting : Yes, No
*/
 
CREATE TABLE "Documents_with_Expenses" (
	"Document_ID" INTEGER NOT NULL, 
	"Budget_Type_Code" CHAR(15) NOT NULL, 
	"Document_Details" VARCHAR(255), 
	PRIMARY KEY ("Document_ID"), 
	FOREIGN KEY("Budget_Type_Code") REFERENCES "Ref_Budget_Codes" ("Budget_Type_Code"), 
	FOREIGN KEY("Document_ID") REFERENCES "Documents" ("Document_ID")
)
/*
Columns in Documents_with_Expenses and all categories for low cardinality columns :
Document_ID : 300, 240, 309, 226, 367, 371, 383, 227, 192, 57
Budget_Type_Code : GV, SF, ORG
Document_Details : government, safety, organization
*/
 
CREATE TABLE head (
	"head_ID" INTEGER, 
	name TEXT, 
	born_state TEXT, 
	age REAL, 
	PRIMARY KEY ("head_ID")
)
/*
Columns in head and all categories for low cardinality columns :
head_ID : 1, 2, 5, 7, 8, 4, 6, 3, 10, 9
name : Jeff Maggert, Pádraig Harrington, Billy Mayfair, K. J. Choi, Dudley Hart, Sergio García, Stewart Cink, Tiger Woods, Nick Faldo, Franklin Langham
born_state : Delaware, Connecticut, Alabama, California, Florida
age : 69.0, 67.0, 68.0, 53.0, 56.0, 52.0, 50.0, 43.0
*/
 
CREATE TABLE department (
	"Department_ID" INTEGER, 
	"Name" TEXT, 
	"Creation" TEXT, 
	"Ranking" INTEGER, 
	"Budget_in_Billions" REAL, 
	"Num_Employees" REAL, 
	PRIMARY KEY ("Department_ID")
)
/*
Columns in department and 3 examples in each column for high cardinality columns :
Department_ID : 1, 13, 11
Name : Energy, Interior, Health and Human Services
Creation : 1913, 1979, 1989
Ranking : 1, 13, 11
Budget_in_Billions : 10.7, 77.6, 59.7
Num_Employees : 112557.0, 3000000.0, 235000.0
*/

 
CREATE TABLE "Customers" (
	customer_id INTEGER, 
	customer_address_id INTEGER NOT NULL, 
	customer_status_code VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL, 
	date_became_customer DATETIME, 
	date_of_birth DATETIME, 
	first_name VARCHAR(80), 
	last_name VARCHAR(80), 
	amount_outstanding DOUBLE, 
	email_address VARCHAR(250), 
	phone_number VARCHAR(255), 
	cell_mobile_phone_number VARCHAR(255), 
	PRIMARY KEY (customer_id), 
	FOREIGN KEY(customer_address_id) REFERENCES "Addresses" (address_id)
)
/*
Columns in Customers and 3 examples in each column for high cardinality columns :
customer_id : 1, 13, 11
date_became_customer : 2016-03-18 06:14:18, 2016-05-13 07:38:23, 2017-10-05 14:15:46
date_of_birth : 1994-05-07 01:32:16, 1991-12-05 02:50:15, 1998-09-18 04:45:01
first_name : Millie, Dianna, Carole
last_name : Schmeler, Tromp, Goodwin
amount_outstanding : 7093.0, 8144.0, 9447.0
email_address : mariela28@example.org, wehner.harold@example.com, afranecki@example.com
phone_number : 1-618-535-9750, 218.550.1362, 753.921.0871
cell_mobile_phone_number : 578-518-4785x612, (780)719-4206x033, (630)964-2426
*/
/*
Columns in Customers and all categories for low cardinality columns :
customer_address_id : 1, 13, 2, 7, 8, 12, 10, 9
customer_status_code : Bad Customer, Good Customer
*/
 
CREATE TABLE "Instruments" (
	"SongId" INTEGER, 
	"BandmateId" INTEGER, 
	"Instrument" TEXT, 
	PRIMARY KEY ("SongId", "BandmateId", "Instrument"), 
	FOREIGN KEY("SongId") REFERENCES "Songs" ("SongId"), 
	FOREIGN KEY("BandmateId") REFERENCES "Band" ("Id")
)
/*
Columns in Instruments and all categories for low cardinality columns :
SongId : 
BandmateId : 
Instrument : 
*/
 
CREATE TABLE "Apartments" (
	apt_id INTEGER NOT NULL, 
	building_id INTEGER NOT NULL, 
	apt_type_code CHAR(15), 
	apt_number CHAR(10), 
	bathroom_count INTEGER, 
	bedroom_count INTEGER, 
	room_count CHAR(5), 
	PRIMARY KEY (apt_id), 
	FOREIGN KEY(building_id) REFERENCES "Apartment_Buildings" (building_id), 
	UNIQUE (apt_id)
)
/*
Columns in Apartments and 3 examples in each column for high cardinality columns :
apt_id : 1, 13, 11
apt_number : Suite 307, Apt. 411, Apt. 585
*/
/*
Columns in Apartments and all categories for low cardinality columns :
building_id : 153, 673, 808, 744, 624, 790, 191, 734, 225
apt_type_code : Studio, Flat, Duplex
bathroom_count : 1, 2, 3
bedroom_count : 5, 4, 6, 3
room_count : 5, 7, 8, 6, 3, 9
*/
 
CREATE TABLE "Customers" (
	customer_id INTEGER, 
	customer_first_name VARCHAR(20), 
	customer_last_name VARCHAR(20), 
	customer_address VARCHAR(255), 
	customer_phone VARCHAR(255), 
	customer_email VARCHAR(255), 
	other_customer_details VARCHAR(255), 
	PRIMARY KEY (customer_id)
)
/*
Columns in Customers and 3 examples in each column for high cardinality columns :
customer_id : 1, 13, 11
customer_first_name : Armani, Bryce, Nat
customer_last_name : Swift, Lind, Huels
customer_address : 6478 Moen Isle Suite 910
Schimmelmouth, VT 96364-4898, 47286 Mraz Park Apt. 424
Jocelynfurt, OH 59023-2787, 094 Julianne Mill
Webstertown, KY 91980-4004
customer_phone : (415)237-0701x3115, 679-845-8645x94312, 284.749.0453
customer_email : kyra.murazik@example.org, schaden.katrina@example.net, huels.antonina@example.com
*/
/*
Columns in Customers and all categories for low cardinality columns :
other_customer_details : None
*/
 
CREATE TABLE "Guests" (
	guest_id INTEGER NOT NULL, 
	gender_code CHAR(1), 
	guest_first_name VARCHAR(80), 
	guest_last_name VARCHAR(80), 
	date_of_birth DATETIME, 
	PRIMARY KEY (guest_id), 
	UNIQUE (guest_id)
)
/*
Columns in Guests and 3 examples in each column for high cardinality columns :
guest_id : 1, 13, 11
guest_first_name : Louvenia, Lou, Keith
guest_last_name : Bode, Mante, Schowalter
date_of_birth : 2001-06-18 20:05:55, 1980-06-20 18:15:39, 1997-01-15 17:37:40
*/
/*
Columns in Guests and all categories for low cardinality columns :
gender_code : Male, Unknown, Female
*/
 
CREATE TABLE school_details (
	"School_ID" INTEGER, 
	"Nickname" TEXT, 
	"Colors" TEXT, 
	"League" TEXT, 
	"Class" TEXT, 
	"Division" TEXT, 
	PRIMARY KEY ("School_ID"), 
	FOREIGN KEY("School_ID") REFERENCES school ("School_ID")
)
/*
Columns in school_details and all categories for low cardinality columns :
School_ID : 1, 2, 5, 4, 6, 3
Nickname : Auks, Raiders, Silver Eagles, Seahawks, Buccaneers, Tigers
Colors : Dark Green and White, Blue and Yellow, Maroon and White, Blue and Gold, Garnet and White, Silver and Maroon
League : DSHA
Class : Flight B, Flight A, Fight A
Division : Division 1, Division 2, Division 3
*/
 
CREATE TABLE people (
	"People_ID" INTEGER, 
	"Sex" TEXT, 
	"Name" TEXT, 
	"Date_of_Birth" TEXT, 
	"Height" REAL, 
	"Weight" REAL, 
	PRIMARY KEY ("People_ID")
)
/*
Columns in people and all categories for low cardinality columns :
People_ID : 1, 2, 5, 7, 8, 4, 6, 3, 9
Sex : F, M
Name : Vincent Montméat, Frantz Granvorka, Loïc De Kergret, Philippe Barça-Cysique, Guillaume Samica, Stéphane Antiga, Dominique Daquin, Laurent Capet, Hubert Henno
Date_of_Birth : 20.08.1970, 10.03.1976, 05.05.1972, 28.09.1981, 22.04.1977, 01.09.1977, 10.11.1972, 06.10.1976, 03.02.1976
Height : 196.0, 195.0, 197.0, 188.0, 193.0, 200.0, 202.0, 194.0
Weight : 89.0, 82.0, 85.0, 88.0, 90.0, 92.0, 83.0, 94.0
*/
 
CREATE TABLE protein (
	common_name TEXT, 
	protein_name TEXT, 
	divergence_from_human_lineage REAL, 
	accession_number TEXT, 
	sequence_length REAL, 
	sequence_identity_to_human_protein TEXT, 
	"Institution_id" TEXT, 
	PRIMARY KEY (common_name), 
	FOREIGN KEY("Institution_id") REFERENCES "Institution" ("Institution_id")
)
/*
Columns in protein and all categories for low cardinality columns :
common_name : Tropical Clawed Frog, porkworm, body louse, southern house mosquito, purple sea urchin
protein_name : uncharacterized protein LOC578090, conserved hypothetical protein, Centromeric protein E, putative, surface antigen repeat family protein, uncharacterized protein C20orf117-like
divergence_from_human_lineage : 937.5, 742.9, 782.7, 371.2
accession_number : XP_003380263.1, XP_002942331.1, XP_783370.2, XP_002429877.1, XP_001843754.1
sequence_length : 2030.0, 1587.0, 2086.0, 1584.0, 1878.0
sequence_identity_to_human_protein : 30%, 47%, 36%, 39%, 32%
Institution_id : 1, 5, 9, 3
*/
 
CREATE TABLE "Products" (
	product_id INTEGER, 
	color_code VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL, 
	product_category_code VARCHAR(15) NOT NULL, 
	product_name VARCHAR(80), 
	typical_buying_price VARCHAR(20), 
	typical_selling_price VARCHAR(20), 
	product_description VARCHAR(255), 
	other_product_details VARCHAR(255), 
	PRIMARY KEY (product_id), 
	FOREIGN KEY(color_code) REFERENCES "Ref_Colors" (color_code), 
	FOREIGN KEY(product_category_code) REFERENCES "Ref_Product_Categories" (product_category_code)
)
/*
Columns in Products and 3 examples in each column for high cardinality columns :
product_id : 1, 13, 11
product_name : peper, cumin, chili
typical_buying_price : , 5.578, 503.8431967
typical_selling_price : , 149, 10377614.847385
product_description : ut, et, vel
*/
/*
Columns in Products and all categories for low cardinality columns :
color_code : 1, 2, 5, 7, 4, 9
product_category_code : Spices, Seeds, Herbs
other_product_details : None
*/
 
CREATE TABLE film_text (
	film_id SMALLINT NOT NULL, 
	title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, 
	description TEXT, 
	PRIMARY KEY (film_id)
)
/*
Columns in film_text and all categories for low cardinality columns :
film_id : 
title : 
description : 
*/
 
CREATE TABLE "Student" (
	"StuID" INTEGER, 
	"LName" VARCHAR(12), 
	"Fname" VARCHAR(12), 
	"Age" INTEGER, 
	"Sex" VARCHAR(1), 
	"Major" INTEGER, 
	"Advisor" INTEGER, 
	city_code VARCHAR(3), 
	PRIMARY KEY ("StuID")
)
/*
Columns in Student and 3 examples in each column for high cardinality columns :
StuID : 1003, 1017, 1002
LName : Lee, Han, Brody
Fname : Tracy, Michael, Shiela
Advisor : 7723, 7712, 7134
city_code : ATL, HOU, LON
*/
/*
Columns in Student and all categories for low cardinality columns :
Age : 26, 16, 20, 17, 21, 19, 18, 27, 22
Sex : F, M
Major : 520, 100, 50, 600, 540, 550
*/
 
CREATE TABLE pilot (
	"Pilot_ID" INTEGER, 
	"Pilot_name" TEXT, 
	"Rank" INTEGER, 
	"Age" INTEGER, 
	"Nationality" TEXT, 
	"Position" TEXT, 
	"Join_Year" INTEGER, 
	"Team" TEXT, 
	PRIMARY KEY ("Pilot_ID")
)
/*
Columns in pilot and all categories for low cardinality columns :
Pilot_ID : 1, 2, 5, 4, 3
Pilot_name : Patrick O'Bryant, Charles Oakley, Dan O'Sullivan, Hakeem Olajuwon, Jermaine O'Neal
Rank : 34, 13, 45, 6
Age : 37, 33, 40, 32, 22
Nationality : United States, Nigeria, United Kindom
Position : Center Team, Forward Team, Forward-Center Team
Join_Year : 2009, 2001, 2008, 1999, 2010
Team : Fordham, Eau Claire High School, Bradley, Virginia Union, Houston
*/
 
CREATE TABLE flight (
	id INTEGER, 
	"Vehicle_Flight_number" TEXT, 
	"Date" TEXT, 
	"Pilot" TEXT, 
	"Velocity" REAL, 
	"Altitude" REAL, 
	airport_id INTEGER, 
	company_id INTEGER, 
	PRIMARY KEY (id), 
	FOREIGN KEY(company_id) REFERENCES operate_company (id), 
	FOREIGN KEY(airport_id) REFERENCES airport (id)
)
/*
Columns in flight and 3 examples in each column for high cardinality columns :
id : 1, 13, 11
Vehicle_Flight_number : M2-F1 #14, M2-F1 #61, M2-F1 #0
Date : July 16, 1965, May 19, 1964, March 28, 1966
*/
/*
Columns in flight and all categories for low cardinality columns :
Pilot : Thompson, Peterson
Velocity : 240.0, 135.0
Altitude : 3650.0, 0.0
airport_id : 1, 2, 5, 8, 4, 6, 3, 9
company_id : 1, 13, 11, 2, 5, 7, 4, 6, 3, 9
*/
 
CREATE TABLE "Type_Of_Restaurant" (
	"ResID" INTEGER, 
	"ResTypeID" INTEGER, 
	FOREIGN KEY("ResID") REFERENCES "Restaurant" ("ResID"), 
	FOREIGN KEY("ResTypeID") REFERENCES "Restaurant_Type" ("ResTypeID")
)
/*
Columns in Type_Of_Restaurant and all categories for low cardinality columns :
ResID : 1, 2
ResTypeID : 1, 2
*/
List the name, born state and age of the heads of departments ordered by age.

To construct the query, I'll be working with the following tables: head.
From these tables, I'll be using the following columns: name, born_state, age.
The SQL query I'll be generating is:
SELECT name ,  born_state ,  age FROM head ORDER BY age
